title: As it happened: Queen Elizabeth II's record-breaking day - BBC News
summary: queen elizabeth ii becomes britain 's longest-reigning monarch .
prime minister david cameron leads tributes in the house of commons .
the queen makes a brief speech as she opens scotland 's new borders railway .
she says : `` a long life can pass by many milestones . my own is no exception . `` .
the record was held by her great-great-grandmother queen victoria .
a flotilla of historic vessels , leisure cruisers and passenger boats take part in a procession on the thames .

documents.title: goodbye
text: we are now ending the live coverage of the queen 's record-breaking day .
for more updates click

documents.title: memories of the queen from canada
text: robert g little , from new brunswick , canada , has emailed in to share his memories of the queen .
he writes : `` i have met the queen three times , once while serving in the royal canadian mounted police in gander , newfoundland .
hm was arriving in gander on an unofficial stop-over from a holiday in the usa .
she was dressed in a head scarf , barbour jacket and slacks .
she came to me with her hand extended , i saluted her and shook her hand .
she said she always liked coming to canada and seeing her mounties , she asked my name and said , `` nice to meet you bob little '' .
and they say mounties do n't cry - this one does ! ''

documents.title: super mario jumps for joy over queen 's record
text: of all the tributes being paid to her majesty today , perhaps the most unexpected is from mario - of nintendo computer game fame - who has given her some exuberant well wishes .
you can hear them , and from the man behind the voice , charles martinet , in this clip from bbc radio 5 live .

documents.title: sturgeon says 'heartfelt thank you ' from global viewers
text: ms sturgeon , in her earlier speech , greeted the queen with thanks for her work as the longest-reigning monarch .
`` we are privileged ma'am that you have chosen to mark today 's milestone here , '' she said .
`` all of us are delighted to be able to share some of this special day with you .
for those watching from around the world let me say , on their behalf ma'am , a simple but heartfelt thank you . ''

documents.title: footage of queen 's speech at tweedbank
text: here 's footage of the queen 's speech at tweedbank station , as she marks both the opening of the new railway line , and also mentions her record-breaking day

documents.title: queen looks around tweedbank station
text: the queen has delivered her speech at tweedbank station - here 's footage of her arriving at that stop , which is the end of the new borders railway line

documents.title: queen never 'aspired ' to reign record
text: the queen also noted in her speech how many people , including the first minister nicola sturgeon , `` have also kindly noted another significance attached to today , although it is not one to which i have ever aspired '' .

documents.title: queen thanks all for 'great kindness '
text: regarding the celebrations for her record-breaking reign , the queen also says : `` i thank you all , and the many others at home and overseas , for your touching messages of great kindness . ''

documents.title: breakingqueen makes speech at tweedbank
text: the queen makes a brief speech at tweedbank station , unveiling a plaque for the official opening of the new borders railway .
`` a long life can pass by many milestones .
my own is no exception , '' she says , of her reign .

documents.title: sturgeon pays tribute to queen 's 'dedication and wisdom '
text: speaking at tweedbank , first minister nicola sturgeon says the queen has carried out her duties throughout her reign `` with dedication , wisdom and an exemplary sense of public service '' .

documents.title: queens wants day marked in low-key way
text: the bbc 's nicholas witchell says the crowds at tweedbank are n't huge but the whole day is being marked in a very low-key way .

he believes she feels something is not quite right about celebrating passing a record set by her own great-great grandmother - queen victoria - but much of the rest of country does want to mark her long reign .

documents.title: 'queen called me a sweet little boy'emmanuel kenechukwu , in lagos , nigeria emails :
text: i met the queen when she came to nigeria , i offered her a flower at the airport and she said `` you are a sweet little boy '' .
i was grinning from ear to ear !

documents.title: town crier rings in the historic news
text: it 's not just the bbc bringing you the latest news about the queen today - english town crier tony appleton has been proclaiming her record reign outside buckingham palace .

documents.title: queen , prince philip and nicola sturgeon on train journey
text: no sign of any tea to go with the biscuits , but here 's a shot of a relaxed-looking queen , prince philip and scottish first minister nicola sturgeon , on the train towards their destination of tweedbank .

documents.title: boys brigade member recalls queen 's 'lovely skin'ray macdonald , newbury , emails :
text: to mark the 75th year of the boys brigade , members of the aberdeen battalion paraded in front of her majesty in the grounds of balmoral castle on the 6 september , 1958 .
i was one of the boys..
her majesty passed close by and i remember thinking that i 'd never seen anyone with such lovely skin - truly beautiful .

documents.title: queen 's historic day in
text: want to keep up with some of the many images being taken of the queen 's historic day ?
then keep an eye on this gallery , containing images of her majesty and the many tributes being paid to her today .

documents.title: queen due soon at tweedbank
text: after having had the start of her visit delayed , the queen is now expected at tweedbank at 13:00 bst .

documents.title: royal barge passes beneath tower bridge
text: and here 's some footage of the royal barge passing beneath london 's tower bridge , as part of the thames flotilla marking the queen 's historic day .

documents.title: 'queen mouthed 'how doo ' with a smile'jim priestley , from sheffield , emails :
text: we were at royal ascot in 2013 watching the royal party going around the paddock , as the queen passed by , being a yorkshire lad i said out loud `` how doo '' .
i still swear to this day the queen mouthed how doo back to me with a smile

documents.title: prince andrew : it 's just a normal working day for the queen
text: in a bbc interview , her second eldest son , the duke of york , praises the queen 's consistent leadership over many years .
but , he says , that after spending part of the summer holidays with the queen , she left him in no doubt that she saw today as just a normal working day .

documents.title: cameron 's time with the queen 'inspiring and humbling '
text: during his commons tribute , mr cameron also paid tribute to prince philip who he says has stood beside the queen throughout her reign .
he also says she pioneered the christmas day message , opened up the royal palaces and invented the idea of a walkabout .
his weekly meetings with the queen are , he says , one of the most enjoyable , inspiring and humbling honours of his office .

documents.title: pm : queen 's reign is 'a golden thread through generations '
text: here 's prime minister david cameron leading official tributes in parliament to the queen .
he calls her reign a `` golden thread running through three post-war generations '' .
the pm adds : `` she is our queen and we could not be more proud of her .
she has served this country with unerring grace , dignity and decency and long may she continue to do so . ''

documents.title: republican says monarchy is 'wrong '
text: the many well-wishers that the queen has do not include graham smith , a campaigner from the group republic , which campaigns for the abolition of the monarchy and calls for a directly-elected head of state .
in a personal film for daily politics , he says the monarchy is `` wrong for pragmatic , principled and political reasons '' .

documents.title: flotilla on its way down the thames
text: the flotilla down the thames to mark the queen 's special day is under way .
tower bridge has been raised as the vessels came through .
hms belfast sounded and has fired a gun salute four times as the flotilla makes its way past .

documents.title: pictures : crowds turn out for queen 's visit
text: pictures : crowds turn out for queen 's visit

documents.title: queen 's journey on new borders railway
text: cheering crowds greeted the queen in edinburgh on the day she becomes britain 's longest reigning monarch .

bad weather delayed her arrival at waverley station , but the 89-year-old queen - wearing a two-tone blue coat and matching hat - and the duke of edinburgh eventually set off on the new borders railway .

documents.title: harman 's speech brings laughter to the commons
text: labour leader harriet harman says : `` her life has been a great sweep of british history and it is no exaggeration to say that she is admired by billions of people around the world '' .
the acting labour leader causes amusement in the chamber by remarking that her majesty is now on her 12th prime minister `` although we on these benches had hoped she would now be on her 13th '' .
ms harman provokes another burst of laughter when she says `` the queen reigns over 140 million people - that 's nearly as many as the number of the labour party 's registered supporters '' .

documents.title: queen given bouquets at newtongrange
text: the royal party has stopped off at newtongrange in midlothian , during her journey down the new scottish borders railway .
her majesty has been given plenty of bouquets by well-wishers during her walkabout .

documents.title: labour 's harriet harman pays tribute to the queen
text: the acting leader of the labour party , harriet harman , tells the commons : `` it is entirely characteristic of her that she has let it be known that she does n't want there to be a fuss made about today but we are making a fuss and deservedly so .
`` we send her our warmest congratulations , our appreciation and above all our thanks .
`` there can be no doubt of her commitment .
even today at the age of 89 , she 's undertaking a public engagement . ''

documents.title: pm : 'it 's hard to overstate what she 's done for this country '
text: mr cameron continues his tribute , saying her majesty has played a leading role in building a `` family of nations '' .
as a diplomat and ambassador , it 's hard to overstate what she 's done for this country , he adds .
he also says how people see time and again how her words can build partnerships , and how she 's held in deep affection by leaders around the world .

documents.title: footage of the royal party 's train leaving edinburgha bbc scotland journalist tweets :
text: the union of south africa pulling out of edinburgh waverley

@ twitterid @ twitterid modern transport under the scottish gov/

documents.title: first investiture of queen 's reign recalls his unforgettable day
text: just three weeks after princess elizabeth became queen , bill speakman went to buckingham palace to be awarded the victoria cross , in the first investiture of the queen 's reign .
he received the vc for holding off a wave of attacks in the korean war .
now 91 , mr speakman told bbc radio 5 live daily 's peter allen what he remembers of meeting the queen that day .

documents.title: tributes to the queen due in the lords
text: we are expecting parliamentary tributes to the queen in the house of lords to start at 14:30 bst .
this will be led by baroness stowell , leader of the house of lords .

documents.title: cameron pays tribute
text: david cameron is speaking now in the house of commons , and tells mps it is `` truly humbling '' to comprehend the scale of service that the queen has given this country .

documents.title: the queen 's reign in numbers
text: the queen 's reign in numbers

documents.title: the queen is handed flowers on her milestone day
text: the queen was all smiles as she was handed a posy of flowers before getting on board the train .
she is wearing a turquoise and blue outfit - accessorised by her trusty black handbag .

documents.title: royals all aboard the new scottish railway
text: the queen and prince philip , with scottish first minister nicola sturgeon , are all now aboard the pegasus pullman steam train , chugging their way down the new £ 294m scottish borders railway towards tweedbank .

documents.title: a royal wave as the queen 's train leaves edinburgh
text: scotland reporter tweets :
philip sim
bbcphilipsim
lots of waving from the windows , including from the queen and prince philip , as train pulls away
lots of waving from the windows , including from the queen and prince philip , as train pulls away
@ twitterid @ twitterid two people waving , one of which looks like he thinks hitler is on the traincrash barriers for 14 ?
hahahahaha

documents.title: royal opening for new scottish borders railway
text: the queen is set to open the new £ 294m scottish borders railway .
the royal party will travel the new route , stopping at newtongrange in midlothian before carrying on to the final station , the borders town of tweedbank , where the opening ceremony will be held .

documents.title: queen boards train to tweedbank
text: the queen and prince philip shook hands with scotland 's first minister nicola sturgeon before getting on board the pegasus pullman steam train that will take them to tweedbank .
they are now on their way down the railway line .

documents.title: queen arrives at edinburgh waverley station
text: the royal party arrives at edinburgh waverley station , watched by the crowds gathered there .

documents.title: royal party arrives at edinburgh waverley station
text: the royal motorcade has now arrived at the train station - about 40 minutes behind schedule .
the national youth pipe band of scotland played as the queen and duke of edinburgh left their limousine , to cheers from the crowds .

documents.title: queen 's helicopter lands in edinburgh
text: here 's the queen exiting the helicopter which brought her to edinburgh .
she 's now being taken to meet the crowds at edinburgh waverley station in a limousine .

documents.title: when a pint of beer cost 9p in 1952
text: when the queen came to the throne in 1952 , the average house price in decimalised money was £ 1,888 , a pint of beer cost 9p and a pint of milk 3p .
now , the average house price is £ 277,000 , a pint of draught bitter sells for £ 2.97 and a pint of milk sets you back 43p .

documents.title: the queen arrives in edinburgh
text: the queen - wearing a blue outfit - has arrived at holyrood by helicopter .
she is now making her way to edinburgh waverley station by car .

documents.title: reflections on the queen 's reign by bbc reporters
text: the bbc 's alastair leithead has been back to kenya where princess elizabeth became queen in 1952 .
his report is followed by stories from other commonwealth countries .

text: the queen 's delayed arrival , because of weather conditions , means those gathered at edinburgh waverley station have to wait a bit longer before the royal visitor arrives , as by the bbc 's philip sim .
this also applies to scotland 's first minister nicola sturgeon - might be time for her to have another cup of tea while she waits .

documents.title: crowds gather at train station with union jacks
text: wherever the queen goes , she is greeted by crowds waving the union jack - and today is no exception .
a smartly-dressed emily smith is seen here in edinburgh eagerly awaiting the arrival of the royal party .

documents.title: bt tower broadcasts message for the queen
text: the bt tower is displaying a special message to mark the occasion , with the words `` long may she reign '' scrolling around the central london landmark .

documents.title: royal arrival in edinburgh delayed
text: an update on the queen 's arrival at edinburgh waverley station - this has been delayed for 40 minutes due to weather conditions .
she is due to travel from balmoral by helicopter and make the final part of the journey by limousine .

documents.title: main events of the queen 's historic day
text: here are some of the main events due to take place in the next few hours :

documents.title: scottish pipe band prepares for queen 's arrivalbbc scotland journalist tweets :
text: pipe band leads procession through waverley station
@ twitterid @ twitterid do love the sound of a pipe band !

documents.title: 'when i met the queen '
text: we 've been asking you to tell us about moments you 've shared with the queen during her reign .
here are 63 memories that have been sent in - one for each year that she has been monarch .

documents.title: her majesty due to arrive in edinburgh
text: the queen and prince philip are due to arrive at edinburgh waverley station shortly , from where they will travel by train to tweedbank , in the borders , with scotland 's first minister nicola sturgeon .

documents.title: new official photographs released
text: a new photograph of the queen , taken by mary mccartney , has been released by buckingham palace to mark today 's milestone .
it shows her in her private audience room at the palace , where she holds weekly audiences with prime ministers of the day , and receives visiting heads of state and government .

documents.title: counting down in numbers
text: the queen will have reigned for 63 years and seven months - calculated at 23,226 days , 16 hours and approximately 30 minutes at about 17:30 bst .
the exact moment the queen reaches the milestone is not known because her father , george vi , passed away in the early hours of 6 february 1952 - probably around 01:00 gmt .

documents.title: marking out a historic day
text: welcome to our coverage of queen elizabeth ii 's record-breaking day , as she becomes the nation 's longest-reigning monarch .
a host of commemorative events are planned to mark the occasion , so follow this page for all the latest updates .
